item.title: Complete Highguard Trophy List—How To Get All Achievements & Trophies
item.content:encoded:
Up until launch, there’s been a mystery surrounding Highguard, but some of the best information surrounding the game came from an unlikely place. The full trophy list has been revealed for Highguard, and it looks like there’s going to be a lot to unpack.

When it was revealed as the final game at the 2025 Game Awards, it’s fair to say that people were underwhelmed to see another free-to-play hero-shooter. However, it’s been developed by some of the masterminds behind Apex Legends and Titanfall, so it deserves a fair chance in the spotlight.

If you’re planning on giving Highguard a chance, here’s the full Trophy list you can work on completing during the raids.

All Highguard Trophies & Achievements

Judging by the Trophy list, it doesn’t seem like you’ll need to sink an overwhelming amount of time into Highguard to 100% it.

Considering it’s a multiplayer shooter, you’ll need to perform certain feats during an online match, but there’s nothing outrageous that demands an elite calibre of skill. A lot of them simply need you to complete matches—that shouldn’t be too hard, right?

That’s enough preamble, though. Here’s the complete Highguard Trophy list from start to finish.

How Many Achievements & Trophies Does Highguard Have?

Highguard has 33 PlayStation Trophies and 32 Xbox Achievements for you to earn.

As usual, PlayStation has one extra Trophy thanks to its ever-coveted Platinum Trophy, which sadly aren’t available to you Xbox gamers out there. But there’s still a healthy batch of Achievements to grind towards, and none of them seem too intensive. Get them all done, and your Gamerscore should rise by a fair amount.

Do you intend to earn all of the Trophies for Highguard? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Highguard, check out all the details surrounding its free-to-play status, as well as what platforms it’s available on.

item.title: Hytale Update 2 Patch Notes And Release Date—New Magic, Mining Overhauled & More
item.content:encoded:
You can’t sit still in Hytale before something else changes! Hytale’s founder promised constant improvements, and Update 2 brings new gameplay mechanics, dozens of fixes, and so much more in its January patch notes.

Hytale’s popularity remains strong in its early weeks. This is being helped by the game’s frequent updates and patch notes. Initial changes included adding Dinosaurs, for example. Hytale Update 2 is another fairly hefty proposition, and there’s much to look forward to and discuss.

Hytale Update 2 Release Date

Hytale founder Simon Collins-Laflamme has said Update 2 is arriving “this weekend,” which means it’ll drop between January 23 and January 25.

To add to this, he’s already confirmed that “Update 3 is already in the works,” and the grind never stops!”

Biggest Changes In Hytale Update 2

Pickaxe progression and Mining have been reworked, and new Magic is being added to Hytale, along with a host of cosmetic and customization changes. There are also tons of gameplay fixes, balance tweaks, and overall QOL improvements across visual and audio.

It’s a fairly meaty update that targets all aspects of Hytale. Obviously, the standout aspects of Update 2 are the physical gameplay flourishes. New magic will sharpen up and broaden the action, making it even more fun.

Collins-Laflamme recently revealed he wasn’t happy with the state of the game’s Mining, which is why it’s not a surprise to see how it’s been changed in Update 2: “Pickaxe progression reworked: mining speed now scales with pickaxe quality.”

All Hytale Update 2 Patch Notes

Here’s a look at every single change outlined for Update 2, and there’s always the chance something sneaks under the radar, gets left out, or might not make the final cut by the time the full update launches.

Cosmetics & Customization

New mask face accessories (available for all editions)

  • Armor slot visibility toggle (host-enforced for PvP/immersion)
  • New mouth variants: Vampire, Cute, Orc (all editions)
  • Berserker haircut tiling fixed
  • Updated haircuts, cape animations, petals & cloth visuals

Gameplay & Balance

  • New magic! Necromancy grimoire! Drops from Skeleton Praetorian, lets you raise up to 5 skeletal minions from bone piles (5-min duration or until summoner dies)
  • Adamantite now requires a Thorium or Cobalt pickaxe
  • Pickaxe progression reworked: mining speed now scales with pickaxe quality
  • Faster rail karts (still not great, but faster!)
  • Tower exploit fixed (NPCs can now throw rocks at players)
  • Buffed polar bears and multiple skeleton types
  • All crops can now place produce in the world
  • Missing decorative light blocks added to furniture bench
  • Adjusted hide drops (Light → Medium for some NPCs like cows)
  • Added permission for world map teleporting
  • Magma Rhino Toad attack updates (…maybe accidental buff)

World Generation

  • WorldGen V2 prepared for public documentation (modder support)
  • New Default_Flat & Default_Void templates using WorldGen V2
  • Hub Portal now spawns with V2 flat worldgen (clear weather, limited fog, new worlds only)
  • Major ore placement refactor in all zones – More ores, especially in Devastated Lands underground – Requires new chunks in existing worlds
  • Zone 1 dungeon environment fixes + new environment fixes (you might hear new soundtracks)

Farming

  • Eternal crops no longer break from weapon damage
  • Increased tilled soil lifetime
  • Fixed soil decay under fully grown crops

UI / UX

  • Improved editor block tooltips
  • Clothing color tooltips added
  • Better hotbar active-slot contrast (diamond indicator, helpful in Howling Sands)
  • Memory categories sorted alphabetically
  • Scripted Brush QoL improvements
  • Inventory interaction updates (e.g. new keybind to pull all items from chests)
  • Optional FPS counter overlay
  • Player markers added to compass
  • Ophidiophobia accessibility mode

Audio

  • Added basic Rex sounds + additional audio fixes

Bug Fixes, Tech & Stability

  • Server self-updater
  • Shadow improvements
  • Pick block works when hotbar is full
  • Asset editor documentation fixed
  • Mantling fixes
  • Keybind persistence fixed
  • Improved weather transitions (still not perfect, but smoother)
  • Teleporter offset fixed
  • Rail karts now consume & place correctly
  • Bed respawn in unloaded chunks fixed
  • Food particle tint updates
  • Major server stability, validation, ECS, localization & timeout improvements

Thanks to @Simon_Hypixel for the patch notes.

item.title: Highguard Trophy List Has Revealed More Details Than The Devs Have
item.content:encoded:
Highguard’s Trophy List has surfaced online, revealing the most information about the game we have received yet, including mechanics, game modes, and more.

The upcoming free-to-play, PvP raid shooter by Wildlight Entertainment, Highguard, was revealed during The Game Awards 2026, with a brand new flashy trailer. However, since then, the game’s marketing has been almost nonexistent, with virtually no information revealed 4 days before its release. Interestingly, the Highguard Trophy List is doing the job for them.

Highguard Trophy List Reveals Brand New Details

There is a wealth of information contained in Highguard’s Trophy List, which was discovered on Exophase. This list covers various aspects of the game, including mechanics, game systems, characters, and more. It mentions features such as Shieldbreakers, Domesplitter, Revivals, Enemy Orbs, Wall Breaking, and Generators. Additionally, the list includes the names of certain weapons, like the BigRig LMG. Furthermore, it highlights other items, including chests, Rare & Legendary items, and more.

The trophy list also goes through all the different types of Wardens in the game, including Assault Warden, Defensive Warden, Recon Warden, Support Warden, and Destruction Warden. Interested readers can check out Insider Gaming’s Highguard Trophy guide here.

Highguard has some big names attached to it, with the creators of Apex Legends and Titanfall working on the title. However, even though the game is set to release on January 26, 2026, the game’s official YouTube channel has just one video: the reveal trailer shown at The Game Awards. Players have been waiting for more information on the title, but it seems the trophy list might have to suffice until release.

In other news, Highguard developers did not pay for the spot at The Game Awards finale. Additionally, some players suspect that the title could flop. item.title: Fortnite Festival’s Next Major Collab May Have Been Found
item.content:encoded:
The next star of Fortnite Festival may have been uncovered by dataminers, suggesting that the Pink Pony Club could be on it’s way to the game.

Season 12 in Fortnite, starring LISA, is heading toward a conclusion, having been in the game since November 2025, and the end date of February 5 is right around the corner. Now, it appears her successor has been uncovered.

Chappell Roan Potentially Coming to Fortnite

Hints that Chappel Roan is coming to Fortnite have been uncovered by Itsmeleaky on X, who uncovered items in the games files that hint towards the pop star entering the fray.

A microphone and drumset have been discovered in Fortnite’s files, but the biggest hint ofall comes from a significant makeover to the beloved Fortnite llama, which appears to have been inducted into the Pink Pony Club.

The design of the llama looks extremely close to the horse that Chappel Roan has utilized in her concerts around the world, and is therefore a direct hint at the collab.

However, SpushFNBR, who shared the image, added that the collab was not confirmed, and, while the items were found in files, the headliner for the next season of Fortnite Festival could be changed.

If Chappell Roan were to star as the headliner of the next Fortnite Festival season, she would add to the library of Jam Tracks in the game, which already includes hits The Giver, Hot to Go, and Good Luck, Babe!

Would Chappell Roan be a good choice for the headliner in the next Fortnite Festival season? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, take a look at the details of the Dungeons & Dragons collab added to the game, and find out about Fortnite’s new Crown Jam game mode.

item.title: Forza Horizon 6 Release Date Confirmed, Has 4-Day Early Access
item.content:encoded:
Forza Horizon 6’s release date has been confirmed just hours before the upcoming Xbox Developer Direct, with the game releasing on May 19, 2026.

A little over a week ago, a screenshot had appeared revealing details about Playground Games’ upcoming title, Forza Horizon 6. The screenshot provides essential details, including the release date, early access information, and what you can get with the Premium Edition. Now, a reliable source has confirmed all of these details.

Forza Horizon 6 Releases May 2026

The confirmation about Forza Horizon 6’s release date comes from a new report by Dealabs. The report reveals that the release date is indeed set for May 19, 2026, for both the Standard Edition and the Deluxe Edition. Players who purchase the Premium Edition will receive 4 days of Early Access, with the game becoming accessible on May 15, 2026.

Forza Horizon 6’s standard edition has been priced at €69.99 in Europe and $69.99 in the United States. The game will also receive a physical release for the Xbox Series X; however, it will only be available for the Standard edition and will arrive on May 19, 2026, as well. Forza Horizon 6 pre-orders will start one hour after the Xbox Developer Direct today.

Moreover, the Premium Edition bonuses revealed in the earlier screenshot were accurate as well, with players receiving a VIP Membership, Welcome Pack, Car Pass, and Time Attack Car Pack. Additional packs will also be released post-launch. Details about the deluxe edition weren’t revealed.

In other news, here are the details on whether Forza Horizon 6 will be available on PlayStation 5. Additionally, learn more about the game’s new location. item.title: Starfield Co-Lead Designer Reflects on Game’s Shortcomings
item.content:encoded:
The co-lead designer of Starfield is sharing his thoughts on the problems the game encountered.

Kurt Kuhlmann, once known for his work on the Elder Scrolls series for Bethesda, was also co-lead designer of Starfield. Now, he’s discussing some of the difficulties the team faced during the production and development of Starfield and comparing them to his work on The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim.

Kuhlmann Feels Starfield Failed to Come Together as a Cohesive Game

Speaking with PC Gamer, Kurt Kuhlmann explained that, when the game released, he felt it was a good game and suitable for release, but not a great one. He mentions that within Bethesda, some were surprised the game failed to win over players.

One advantage Starfield had was its smoother launch compared to Fallout 76, and Kuhlmann says that difference is why Bethesda gave it so much development time.

“When it came out, I thought it was a good game,” says Kuhlmann. “It was a releasable game, but it wasn’t the best.…

“We had tried to take this huge leap into this new genre with all these new systems and things … I don’t know that you should expect that if you jump into the space combat genre that you’re going to be better or as good as games that just do that, and have maybe been doing it for multiple iterations, right? Like, it was good enough. It wasn’t, like, embarrassing.”

Kurt Kuhlmann also recently discussed his decision to leave Bethesda and his vision for the sixth Elder Scrolls game. Those interested can read his comments on how Star Wars would have influenced the game’s direction at this link.

item.title: 60FPS Updates Now Available For 3 Classic Far Cry Games
item.content:encoded:
Three classic Far Cry games are now officially playable at 60 frames per second, thanks to a new update on January 21.

A trailer for Far Cry 3: Classic Edition, which received a 60FPS update, had previously surfaced, and the team behind the game teased similar updates for Far Cry Primal and Far Cry 3 Blood Dragon. Now, Ubisoft has announced that updates enabling all three games to run at 60FPS are available on all current-gen consoles.

Additionally, all three games are heavily discounted on the PlayStation Store until February 4. Far Cry 3 and Far Cry Primal (Apex Edition) are 75% off, while Blood Dragon is 60% off.

Far Cry 3, Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon, and Far Cry Primal will now run at 60 frames per second (FPS) on PS5, PS5 Pro, and Xbox Series X|S, thanks to a slate of free updates delivered today. As chaos erupts in the Rook Islands, the dystopian future of 2007, and across the Stone Age, the updated frame rate gives players a smoother experience and allows the beautiful (or desolate) locations to shine all the brighter.

In addition to being available for purchase, all three titles are playable on PC with Ubisoft+, on Xbox via Ubisoft+ Premium or Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, and on PlayStation through PlayStation Plus Premium or Extra.

Major Changes Coming to Ubisoft Outside of Far Cry

While this was a positive announcement from Ubisoft on January 21, the company has also made several solemn announcements, including multiple layoffs, as it undergoes a massive restructuring.

As part of this restructuring, the remake of Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time has been officially canceled. Learn more about that here. As for the future of Far Cry beyond gaming, currently, a TV series is in development at FX.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Beyond Good & Evil 2 Survives Ubisoft’s Project Purge
item.content:encoded:
Insider Gaming has learned that one of Ubisoft’s longest in-development projects, Beyond Good & Evil 2 has survived Ubisoft’s latest round of project cancellations.

Beyond Good & Evil 2 continues to make headlines as the longest-in-development title ever, having been in development since its reveal on May 30, 2008, with a total of 6445 days at the time of writing, or, for those who hate math, 17 years, 7 months, and 22 days.

However, the current version of the game has been in development since around 2017, which still means a good 8-9 years of development.

Regardless of records and long-ass development timelines, though, Ubisoft still thinks that Beyond Good & Evil 2 has something to give. Despite the recent restructuring that has seen six games cancelled, including the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake, sources tell Insider Gaming that Beyond Good & Evil 2 is still in active development, at least for the time being.

In 2023, Beyond Good & Evil 2 saw significant changes with Ubisoft Montpellier being under investigation “over an unprecedented number of developers experiencing burnout and going on sick leave.”

According to sources, constant changes, pushbacks, and the lengthy development time have likely cost Ubisoft $500+ million in development costs. But, at least for the time being, Ubisoft feels like it’s a cost that is justified.

As for when Beyond Good & Evil 2 will release, it’s anyone’s guess, but it’s possible the game still won’t be seen for a number of years.

item.title: Sega Unveils Noir Sonic Audio Drama “The Chaotix Casefiles”
item.content:encoded:
The Sonic the Hedgehog team has unveiled a new audio drama that leans into a noir-inspired atmosphere.

On January 20, the Sonic the Hedgehog YouTube channel released a trailer for a new audio drama titled “The Chaotix Casefiles,” launching on January 27 on various podcast platforms. The series centers on Vector the Crocodile, Espio the Chameleon, and Charmy Bee, who run the Chaotix Detective Agency. The series also teases appearances from Sonic and Dr. Eggman.

The world of Sonic the Hedgehog has been thrust into a not-so-dark, not-so-stormy, hard-boiled detective story that probably nobody saw coming. This show has it all. Massive mystery, investigative intrigue, and saxophone. Lots and lots of saxophone.

Follow Sonic and the intrepid Chaotix Detective Agency as they take on their biggest case yet. This high-flying, action-packed adventure will take them across the world, fighting for every clue they can find. It’s one heck of a tale. Which is good, because this story might be the only thing that can save their lives.

All will be revealed in Sonic the Hedgehog Presents: The Chaotix Casefiles. Coming soon to wherever you get your podcasts.

Sonic the Hedgehog is Celebrating its 35th Anniversary

The brand management team behind the Sonic the Hedgehog franchise kicked off the year with a trailer revealing that 2021 would be a big celebration of the 35th anniversary of Sonic the Hedgehog’s debut on the Sega Genesis in 1991. It appears that this audio drama is the first of much more content to come.

As for the Chaotix Detective Agency, the Chaotix first appeared on the Sega 32X in a game helmed by Knuckles the Echidna in 1994. However, beginning with Sonic Heroes in 2004, the trio began making more regular appearances as fan-favorite auxiliary characters in the series.

Now, they’re getting their own hard-boiled spotlight in this upcoming podcast, beginning January 27.
